properties.Title: Man with drinking horn reclining on a wineskin
properties.Desc_title: Man with drinking horn reclining on a wineskin
properties.Desc_text:
Greek, mid-6th century BCE.
Bronze, height: 13 cm (5 1/8 in.);
length: 19.5 cm (7 11/16 in.). From
Didyma (Turkey). Antikensammlung,
Staatliche Museen
zu Berlin, Didyma 110.
properties.Credit: bpk Bildagentur/Antikensammlung, Staatliche Museen, Berlin, Germany/Johaness Laurentius/Art Resource, NY

properties.Title: Fragmentary ram-headed beaker
properties.Desc_text:
Neo-
Assyrian, 8th–7th century
BCE. Terracotta, 13.8 × 11.4 ×
11.1 cm (5 7/16 × 4 1 /2 × 4 3/8 in.).
From House 15 at Ashur (Qalʿat
Sherqat, Iraq). Vorderasiatisches
Museum, Staatliche Museen
zu Berlin, VA 8831.
properties.Credit: © Staatliche Museen zu Berlin - Vorderasiatisches Museum, Photo: Olaf M. Teßmer

properties.Title: Beaker with the forepart of a crested and winged lion
properties.Desc_title: Beaker with the forepart of a crested and winged lion
properties.Desc_text:
Iranian, 6th century
BCE. Gold, height: 17 cm
(6 1 1 / 16 in.); weight: 966.6 g.
Metropolitan Museum of Art,
New York, Fletcher Fund, 1954,
54.3.3.
properties.Credit: © The Metropolitan Museum of Art. Image source: Art Resource, NY

properties.Title: Beaker in the shape of a bent leg
properties.Desc_title: Beaker in the shape of a bent leg
properties.Desc_text:
Etruscan,
550–530 BCE. Terracotta, bucchero,
height: 18.4 cm (7 1 /4 in.);
length: 13. 2 cm (5 3 / 1 6 in.).
Museum of Fine Arts, Boston,
Gift of H. P. Kidder, 80.580.

properties.Title: Trick Vase
properties.Desc_title: Trick vase with bull head spout
properties.Desc_text:
Cypriot, 750–600 BCE. Painted terracotta
Bichrome ware, height:
21 cm (8 1 /4 in.). From Cyprus.
Metropolitan Museum of Art,
New York, The Cesnola Collection,
Purchased by subscription,
1874– 76, 74.51.584.
properties.Credit: © The Metropolitan Museum of Art. Image source: Art Resource, NY

properties.Title: Pitcher in the form of a siren
properties.Desc_title: Pitcher in the form of a siren
properties.Desc_text:
Etruscan,
550–500 BCE. Terracotta,
bucchero, height: 29.1 cm
(11 7 / 1 6 in.). Met ropol i tan
Museum of Ar t, New York,
Rogers Fund, 1918, 18.145.25.
properties.Credit:
© The Metropolitan Museum of Art. Image source: Art Resource, NY

properties.Title: Beak-Spouted Pitcher
properties.Desc_text:
Iranian, 9th–8th century
BCE. Painted terracotta,
height: 18. 5 cm (7 5 / 1 6 in.);
length: 33 cm (13 in.); diameter
(mouth): 18 cm (7 1 /16 in.). Harvard Art Museums/Arthur M.
Sackler Museum, Anonymous gift,
1937.12
properties.Credit: © President and Fellows of Harvard College.

properties.Title: Boar-Shaped Cup
properties.Desc_text:
Greek, Boeotian, 575–550 BCE. Terracot ta, black figure technique, height:
19.2 cm (7 9/16 in.); length: 25 cm
(9 13/16 in.); diameter: 11.9 cm
(4 11 /16 in.). Antikensammlung,
Staatliche Museen zu Berlin,
V.I. 3391.
properties.Credit: bpk Bildagentur/Antikensammlung, Staatliche Museen, Berlin, Germany/Johaness Laurentius/Art Resource, NY

properties.Title: Beaker with the forepart of a winged ram
properties.Desc_title: Beaker with the forepart of a winged ram
properties.Desc_text:
Etruscan, 550–530 BCE. Terracotta, bucchero, height:
16.6 cm (6 9/ 1 6 in.); length:
20.1 cm (7 15/16 in.); diameter:
10.7 cm (4 3/16 in.). From Tomb
K 136, Crocifisso del Tufo necropolis,
at Orvieto (Italy).
Museo Archeologico Nazionale
di Orvieto, Italy, B 619, F 271,
C 33, mag. 103, el. gen. 1326.
properties.Credit: Courtesy of the Polo Museale dell'Umbria, Museo Archeologico Nazionale di Orvieto

properties.Title: Vessel in the Form of a Hump-backed Bull
properties.Desc_title: Vessel in the form of a hump-backed bull
properties.Desc_text:
Iranian, 1350–1000 BCE.
Terracotta, height: 2 6 cm
(10 1 /4 in.); length: 39 cm
(15 3/8 in.). Ashmolean Museum
of Art and Archaeology, University
of Oxford, AN1964.347.
